title: Support of a module
summary: In commutative algebra, the support of a module M over a commutative ring A is the set of all prime ideals p {\displaystyle {\mathfrak {p}}} of A such that M p ≠ 0 {\displaystyle M_{\mathfrak {p}}\neq 0} (that is, the localization of M at p {\displaystyle {\mathfrak {p}}} is not equal to zero).[1] It is denoted by Supp ⁡ M {\displaystyle \operatorname {Supp} M} .  The support is, by definition, a subset of the spectrum of A.
